snippet.title: Donald Trump's 17-day trip to New Jersey golf club 'not a vacation', US President insists
snippet.content:
United States President Donald Trump is taking a break from the capital after a rocky first six months in office, but he insists he is not on holidays. Burdened with West Wing conflict, a stalled legislative agenda and a pile of investigations, Mr Trump departed Washington on Friday afternoon (local time) for a 17-day trip to his private golf club in central New Jersey. He was accompanied by his daughter Ivanka Trump and son-in-law Jared Kushner, both senior advisers, as well as the aide charged with resetting his chaotic administration - new chief of staff John Kelly. Mr Trump said it was not a holiday on Saturday evening, tweeting:
External Link:
Donald Trump tweet: Working in Bedminster, N.J., as long planned construction is being done at the White House. This is not a vacation - meetings and calls! A White House official said Mr Trump's plans for Bedminster included meetings with aides and lawmakers. off the east coast of Australia while trying to land. The White House did not answer questions about whether Mr Trump was golfing, but he did chat with some wedding guests at the club, according to a video posted by WPVI-TV in Philadelphia. Mr Trump sent out a flurry of tweets in the early evening, defending his travel plans and . He also praised Attorney-General Jeff Sessions for pledging to clamp down in government leaks, after previously complaining he was weak on the matter.
Photo:(Reuters: Kevin Lamarque) There is some renovation work underway at the White House while Mr Trump is out of town. Everyone working in the West Wing, including Mr Trump, had to clear out so the Government could replace a 27-year-old heating and cooling system. General Kelly's first week on the job was marked by his efforts to crack down on a disorderly system. He quickly made his presence known, and revising the command structure so that all senior staffers report to him. Still, it is not clear whether Mr Trump will change his Twitter ways. On Tuesday he tweeted that "only the Fake News Media and Trump enemies want me to stop using Social Media". Before he took office, Mr Trump was a frequent critic of former president Barack Obama's vacation and golf habits.
External Link:
Donald Trump tweet: I play golf to relax. My company is in great shape. @BarackObama plays golf to escape work while America goes down the drain.
External Link:
Donald Trump tweet: @BarackObama played golf yesterday. Now he heads to a 10 day vacation in Martha's Vineyard. Nice work ethic.
External Link:
Donald Trump tweet: Can you believe that,with all of the problems and difficulties facing the U.S., President Obama spent the day playing golf.Worse than Carter. So far, Mr Trump has spent 13 of 28 weekends in office away from the White House, mostly at his properties in Palm Beach, Florida, or in Bedminster, New Jersey, according to an Associated Press count. The figures include a weekend during official travel overseas, and Father's Day weekend at Camp David, the government-owned presidential retreat in Maryland. Mr Trump also frequently plays golf at his properties, though the White House typically will not acknowledge that he plays. AP
